title: Create, Connect and Sustain
abstractText:
This project brings together social enterprises that use creative practice as a way of promoting sustainable soicial development, together with art, design and community researchers. 

Working in partnership, we shall design and execute a collaborative research project around a shared set of concerns.

Recognising that creative practitioners are often more comfortable communicating through and around their work than they are using abstract language to discuss research design, we shall be using creative practices as a way of opening up our discussions of the domain, exploring the priorities of the different stakeholders, and developing our detailed research plan.
findingsText: There is a large and diverse group of micro organisations working who combine creative, community and sustainability goals. These organisations are highly valued by the communities where they work and the organisations that we worked with were able to gather substantial evidence of the positive impact that they were achieving. These micro-organisations would welcome support to enable them to meet, exchange ideas and develop their research capacity. Small investments by policy makers in this sector could result in significant benefits. This sector has significant potential to provide social benefits, but is currently underresearched.
